intro: Smithia sensitiva var. abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian sensitive plant, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves that fold inward when touched. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight. Due to its sensitivity to touch and unique appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
